body:
Just realized 1.8 came out. It's that time of the year I guess. Time to update the protocol definition for 1.8.

~~With this, I thought I might try to tackle #65 using roblabla-sauce awesomeness.~~

Turns out, #65 will come later. 

TODO : 

- [x] Update the packet definitions (almost done, just missing the slot (de)serializer).
- [x] Update the tests
- [x] Add new compression system... Mojang why did you change the pipeline again :unamused:
- [x] Smoke test with a full protocol reserializer proxy (decodes every packet, and recodes them, sitting between the client and the server).

comment_data.body:
Looks like adding compression system is going to be non-trivial. From what I gather, it uses gzip based on the size of the payload : 
- During login, server sends client a threshold, above which packets should be encrypted with gzip. 
- After this packet is sent, the "Packet Header" is changed to the following : 

|Field Name        |  Type  |  Notes
|----------------------|----------|-----------
|Packet Length   |  varint  | The packet length, uncompressed
|Data Length      |  varint  | 0 if the packet is uncompressed, the size of the compressed packet otherwise
|Data                  | Buffer  | The packet payload (__including packetId__)

As you can see, most of the effort towards opportunistic packet parsing is broken with this. High fives to useless work.

Because the compression is done on a "per-packet" basis, createPacketBuffer will need *yet another* parameter. Lesight. 
Currently considering passing client to parsePacket and createPacketBuffer. This will allow them to access the state, compression threshold, isServer and packetsToParse easily.

Hey, any luck working on supporting MineCraft 1.8? I'd love to be able to use it!

Thanks,
Nathan

I had 1.8 half-working on my end, but I have a lot of things going on. If enough support for the project is shown, maybe I'll consider finding some time for this project, but as things stand, it'll only come whenever I have some free time or someone shows up and makes a PR for it.

Hello,

Thanks for the reply. I went ahead and just made my server with a Bukkit add on that allows you to code in JavaScript (since I know Java, but I hate it with a passion), but I will definitely code my next one in this library, if it does continue development and become ready by then.

Thanks,
Nathan

----------------------------------------------
Nathan Flurry
InterDazzle, LLC
https://twitter.com/InterDazzle

> On Dec 15, 2014, at 2:33 PM, Robin Lambertz <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> I had 1.8 half-working on my end, but I have a lot of things going on. If enough support for the project is shown, maybe I'll consider finding some time for this project, but as things stand, it'll only come whenever I have some free time or someone shows up and makes a PR for it.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub <https://github.com/andrewrk/node-minecraft-protocol/issues/96#issuecomment-67069820>.
>

I would love to see continued development from here. A couple questions:

A) Would it be possible for other users to contribute to 1.8? What still needs to be done?
B) I know you say you'll only come when you have free time, but how far are you progressed so far?
C) Is the half finished version usable? For example, I may just want to have the client run around on a 1.8 server or go mining, so special 1.8 features such as the new enchanting system wouldn't be a big deal for me if it wasn't included.

Thanks!
- Demi

If my mind serves me well, the half-finished version had some random crashes when testing it against spigot's protocol hack, which is why I never released it (wanted to fix it, never found the time). I'll see if I can push it on a branch next week (currently a bit busy).

Of course, other users can and are encouraged to contribute to 1.8, and to node-minecraft-protocol in general. What needs to be done is quite simple : 

- Update the packet definitions to include any new packets and fix any modified packets since 1.7.10
- Add support for the new compression system

This is all that's technically needed. The packet definition update really is just a lot of manual verification and copy pasting from wiki.vg, the compression support might be a bit more complicated to add in.
I don't know about the compression, but the packet definitions seem easy enough. I'll give it a shot once you put it on a branch :)
Cool :) I'll try to get it up tomorrow.
BTW, just realized it wasn't written anywhere on github except of an obscure entry in package.json, but this project is BSD-licensed. We should probably add a LICENSE file in there...

So what I found was that my WIP branch is completely broken, mostly because I didn't implement it correctly at all (I expected the thing to work in a completely different way than it does). 

Anyway, I'm reimplementing it right now, hopefully should have it done soon (as in today or tomorrow). BTW, I'm on IRC right now if you want to grab me there.

I don't know what the status is on your implementation @roblabla, but I'm almost done with compression. Only thing holding me back is the lack of a good synchronous zlib library, so the way forward might be finding a way to make `write` and `writeRaw` behave asynchronously.

write and writeRaw doesn't return anything though, does it ? Socket.write
is already an async function, so writeRaw isn't synchronous anyway. But
yeah, I was working on making createPacket asynchronous. If you manage to
finish it up, please do a pull request and I'll pull it.

On Tue, Dec 30, 2014 at 9:43 AM, Will Franzen <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I don't know what the status is on your implementation @roblabla
> <https://github.com/roblabla>, but I'm almost done with compression. Only
> thing holding me back is the lack of a good synchronous zlib library, so
> the way forward might be finding a way to make write and writeRaw behave
> asynchronously.
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/andrewrk/node-minecraft-protocol/issues/96#issuecomment-68339347>
> .
>
Looks like it's going to be near-impossible to test compression without updating the rest of the protocol, so I'll do that too. If I get them both working, I'll send a pull request. (@roblabla)

I'm almost done with implementing the new and changed packets in 1.8. There are a few things I left incomplete that I did not understand how to do, and I was hoping you might be able to finish them off @roblabla.

- Functions to read and write the new data type `position`

`position`: 64-bit long split in to three parts, encoded as follows:  `((x & 0x3FFFFFF) << 38) | ((y & 0xFFF) << 26) | (z & 0x3FFFFFF)`

- `map_chunk_bulk` is most likely not done correctly

- `world_particles` is incomplete because I'm not sure how to serialize arrays properly

- `map` seems to have changed, and I have no clue how it is supposed to work now

- `player_info` also changed in a way that I don't quite get

- `update_entity_nbt` is new and requires writing a single NBT tag, which I don't know how to do

EDIT: Forgot to mention, all that I've gotten done is in [packets-1.8](https://github.com/wtfaremyinitials/node-minecraft-protocol/tree/packets-1.8) and [zlib-compression](https://github.com/wtfaremyinitials/node-minecraft-protocol/tree/zlib-compression)
I think I had figured out conditionals, but I'm not sure. I tried to use them in `title` and `world_boundary` plus a few others. You'll have to tell me if I did it right.

Hey,

You guys got an ETA?
@JavaPortal When it's done. And probably a bit earlier if you come in to help :) More seriously, with the addition I just added up here, it should probably be right around the corner.

@roblabla

Awesome news. I would love to help, but raw networking isn't something I'm really good at :/ Thanks for the awesome work

@wtfaremyinitials we need to figure out what packet is wrong. http://wiki.vg/Debugging should be a great help. 

BTW, happy new year everyone :D

@wtfaremyinitials I just reviewed your code for compression aaand it's wrong (probably should have done that earlier). You should read through the [wiki.vg packet format](http://wiki.vg/Protocol#Packet_format), you'll see that even if [```buffer.length > this.compressionThreshold```](https://github.com/wtfaremyinitials/node-minecraft-protocol/blob/675d358dec51d1d3e56068768062881c51b681d1/lib/client.js#L169), you should still pack the packet in the new format, just with dataLength to 0. There are a couple other mistakes, such as giving the wrong value to [packetLength](https://github.com/wtfaremyinitials/node-minecraft-protocol/blob/675d358dec51d1d3e56068768062881c51b681d1/lib/protocol.js#L1295). It's supposed to be the size of the compressed packet, whereas you're always giving it the size of the uncompressed packet. 

I'm going to be forking your work and try to fix it.

Alright, I'm almost done. I got the client not to crash, however the client stays stuck at Logging In, probably because we never send a "Set Compression" packet. Going to fix this, and then open a PR. Huge thanks to you @wtfaremyinitials
Sounds awesome! And happy new year to you too!

Couple of things:

1. Do you still want me to send a PR @roblabla? or did you just manually pull from my fork?

2. I don't think I ever implemented (read/write)Position because I found a potential issue with it. When trying to encode something in a 64 bit int/long, we are getting to numbers so high that the fact that all numbers in JS are floats becomes a problem. I assume that's why writeLong currently takes an array of two numbers. I'm not sure how we should go about fixing that.

Also, Happy New Year to both of you!
@roblabla All of those binary operators are completely over my head. I need to learn them sometime.
@roblabla Just noticed your messages about the compression packet issues. I guess I should have read wiki.vg more closely :stuck_out_tongue:

For some reason I fail to understand, the notchian client no longer logs in when connecting to node-minecraft-protocol. I am guessing you need to actually send the client a map for it to actually display anything. This is slightly annoying...
@roblabla Would you mind pushing your changes? I'd like to try to take a stab at getting it fully working.

And it works ! Hours of debugging, just to find out that it was bugging because the context of "this" is different [there](https://github.com/wtfaremyinitials/node-minecraft-protocol/blob/packets-1.8/lib/client.js#L165).

Anyway, going to push to my branch and open a PR for reviewing. I'd appreciate it if you guys could use it and stress-test it. PR #108
Woo! Sorry, I thought I had replaced all the instances of `this` with `that`. Glad to see it's working now.

Well yeah, about the completely screwing up compression originally @roblabla.

![](http://i.imgur.com/ibEgFUV.png)
Haha yeah I read that. It wasn't too off-the-mark though. It's just the fields inside the compression that needed to have their values changed a little bit.
I would much like to see this happen. Is there any interest in continuing with this project to support the latest version?
see #108 . If I manage to figure out why the thing leaks like crazy, then it can be pushed and called done.
Done

title: Support 1.8
